security: Revealing the establishment of military cover backstops for employees could expose intelligence gathering methods and compromise individuals operating under such cover. Specifically, noting that a W-2 form is being issued by the Army and actions to block records could alert adversaries to the existence of covert operations.
summary: This document notifies relevant divisions about the establishment of a military cover backstop for an employee, detailing actions to be taken regarding record blocking and W-2 issuance.
summary_one_paragraph: This notification, dated June 1964, informs the Chief of the Personnel Operations Division and the relevant Operating Component about the establishment of a military cover backstop for an employee, identified by employee number 32. It outlines actions required, including blocking records, ensuring an Army W-2 is issued, and submitting forms for changes or transfers affecting the cover, emphasizing that the file should be kept on top while the cover is in effect.
title: Notification of Establishment of Military Cover Backstop
recipient: Chief, Personnel Operations Division; Chief, Operating Component
